other_tests.findings: No dilatation of the pancreatic duct.
Nonbleeding, external hemorrhoids that were small (<1 cm in diameter); the findings were otherwise normal.

Renal tubules showed signs of acute injury with dilatation, epithelial-cell vacuolization and flattening, and loss of the brush border; calcifications present in tubular lumens indicative of acute phosphate nephropathy.
